title: [Large-scale] 4C Competency-Based Physics Teacher Education Design and Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physics knowledge, pedagogical methods comprehension, and awareness of 4C competencies (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication)
context.additional_context: Process focused on strengthening pre-service teachers' competencies in designing and evaluating physics lessons integrated with 4C skills. Includes project-based assessments using digital tools and peer feedback sessions.

learning_goals: Design a physics lesson module (teaching-learning plan) reflecting 4C competencies and develop the ability to analyze it using an assessment rubric.

During the intermediate course (2â€“4 weeks), learners will develop one student worksheet (LKPD) systematically integrating creativity (three or more idea diversities) and critical thinking (five or more evidence-based evaluation questions) elements, and submit a result that meets four or more items on a peer evaluation rubric of five items.

Learners can diagnose the effectiveness of three or more peer-designed science learning materials through peer assessment and submit a one-page report proposing improvements that meet at least two of the given criteria: clarity, scientific accuracy, and educational utility.

resources: Digital Instructional Tools (Tablet, LMS Access Permissions)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
